oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Department of Energy Photograph Collection
Luther Brannon home
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: A one story stone home with "D-305" on a sign on the front.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Housing
Brannon, Luther; Hackworth; Owen
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Built in 1941 by Owen Hackworth, this house is the only pre-war house that remains in the city. It was used as a residence and headquarters for General Groves early in the Manhattan Project.
oai_dc:dc.dc:rights: Physical rights are retained by the institution. Copyright is retained in accordance with U. S. Copyright laws.
